ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes. A good class, a lot to learn.

I would recommend the class to others for sure. The class is a very good follow-up class of financial econ I. Covering many topics and stylized a bit to friction asset pricing. Most of the commonly used empirical asset pricing tools are provided. Most importantly it is fun!
I would highly recommend this course to any student interested in conducting research in the area of asset pricing.
Excellent course I would highly recommend this class to the incoming first years as it is very informative and also provides a great foundation for the first year paper.
Would recommend enthusiastically. Perfect for anyone looking to get started with research in asset pricing.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It definitely helps us develop research ideas and teaches us how to do formal tests and robustness checks to satisfy the rigorous scientific standard of publication.
This is clearly one of the most helpful classes I've taken for future research.
Yes, it deepen my knowledge of the field by a lot. I will probably work on some of the topics.
This course greatly improved my knowledge of empirical research and also taught me very useful coding skills necessary for empirical work.
Helped me to get started on a reasearch project.
